member.name: IDXGIDevice1.GetMaximumFrameLatency
member.summary: Gets the number of frames that the system is allowed to queue for rendering.
member.param:
This value is set to the number of frames that can be queued for render.
This value defaults to 3, but can range from 1 to 16.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise, returns one of the following members of the D3DERR enumerated type:

member.name: IDXGIDevice1.SetMaximumFrameLatency
member.summary: Sets the number of frames that the system is allowed to queue for rendering.
member.param: The maximum number of back buffer frames that a driver can queue. The value defaults to 3, but can range from 1 to 16. A value of 0 will reset latency to the default. For multi-head devices, this value is specified per-head.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise, DXGI_ERROR_DEVICE_REMOVED if the device was removed.

member.name: IDXGIDevice1
member.summary: An IDXGIDevice1 interface implements a derived class for DXGI objects that produce image data.
